text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^3 \rightarrow \mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] be a reflection across some plane through the origin, and let [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] be its standard matrix. Then the columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] must form an orthonormal basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline].

font.p: We can see that [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] preserves distances and thus norms, so [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] does as well. Hence [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is an orthogonal matrix and its columns form an orthonormal basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline].
